docs.title: Making diffraction data analysis easy
docs.text:
EasyDiffraction is a scientific software for the calculation of neutron powder diffraction pattern based on a structural model and refinement of its parameters against experimental data.

EasyDiffraction is distributed both as a cross-platform desktop application and as a Python library.

Here you can find how to use the EasyDiffraction graphical user interface. The EasyDiffraction library documentation can be found elsewhere.

docs.title: Data processing workflow
docs.text: Bla bla bla

docs.title: User Interface
docs.text: Here you can see what the program looks like. The application window is divided into parts that provide you with quick and easy access to everything you'll need. The parts are Toolbar, Main Window, Sidebar and Status Bar described in the following sections.

docs.title: Toolbar
docs.text:
The Toolbar at the top of the application window contains three groups of buttons, indicated on the screenshot below.

The left and right groups of buttons, group A and group B, allow you to call some basic application actions, such as saving the project state, undo/redo settings, etc.

The central group of buttons, group B, represents the data analysis workflow. After the application starts, all the toolbar workflow buttons except the Home button are disabled. When each step in the workflow is completed, the toolbar workflow button which corresponds to the next step becomes enabled.

The following workflow buttons or workflow steps are present:

  1. Home introduction page, links to about, help and contact.
  2. Project to manage your project (create new, open existing, etc.)
  3. Model to describe crystallographic phase models.
  4. Experiment to load experimentally measured data files.
  5. Analysis to perform refinement of structural parameters.
  6. Summary to view and export summary report.

docs.title: Main window
docs.text: The Main Window of the program is located below the Toolbar and it can contain several tabs depending on the current step in the data analysis workflow. An example of the Main Window for the analysis step is shown in the figure below.

docs.title: Sidebar
docs.text:
The Sidebar is located at the right side of the application window, below the Toolbar. It has 2 tabs: Basic controls and Advanced controls. Their contents depend on the selected tab in the Toolbar and the respective tab in the Main Window. You can switch between them at any time clicking on the required tab.

  1. Basic controls tab provides an access to essential actions and information fields.
  2. Advanced controls tab describes additional actions recommended for advanced users.
  3. Text mode tab contains all controls in plain text, as STAR/CIF.

docs.title: Statusbar
docs.text: The Statusbar is located at the very bottom of the application window. It contains some important information, such as project name, number of defined models and experimental data sets, selected calculation engine and minimization module, etc.

docs.title: Installation from source
docs.text:
If the relevant EasyDiffraction installation does not work on your system, then please try running it from source.

  • Clone easyDiffractionApp repo from GitHub, e.g. using
$ git clone https://github.com/easyscience/easyDiffractionApp
  • Go to easyDiffractionApp directory
$ cd easyDiffractionApp
  • Create Python environment and activate it
$ python3.11 -m venv .venv
$ source .venv/bin/activate
  • Upgrade PIP and install dependences
$ pip install --upgrade pip
$ pip install lmfit orjson jsbeautifier
$ pip install git+https://github.com/ikibalin/cryspy.git@beta
$ pip install git+https://github.com/easyscience/EasyApp.git@new-easy-app2
  • Launch EasyDiffraction application using Python
$ cd EasyDiffractionApp
$ python main.py

docs.title: Downloading
docs.text: To make the installation of EasyDiffraction as easy as possible, we prepared installers for three major operating systems: Windows, macOS and Linux (Ubuntu). You can download the latest version from the EasyDiffraction home page. All previous versions are available on the GitHub releases page.

docs.title: Installing
docs.text: Run EasyDiffraction installer and follow the instructions.

docs.title: Possible Issues
docs.text:
• On macOS, if you see the message EasyDiffractionSetup.app can't be opened because it is from an unidentified developer, do the following: In the Finder, locate the EasyDiffraction installer application, then control-click the installer icon, then choose Open from the shortcut menu and finally click Open.
  • On Linux based system there can be the following error on startup: Failed to create OpenGL context for format QSurfaceFormat. This is due to a system OpenGL driver problem. Please re-install your graphics card drivers.

docs.title: Uninstalling
docs.text: Run MaintenanceTool from the EasyDiffraction installation directory, select Remove all components and follow the instructions.

docs.title: Release history
docs.text: This page summarizes the changes between official stable releases of EasyDiffraction.

docs.title: New Features
docs.text:
• Simulating and fitting polarised data using the CrysPy calculation engine.
  • Reading CIF files with experimental data and instrumental parameters.

docs.title: Changes
docs.text:
• Default example with experimental phase has been modified.
  • Added example projects with polarised data.
  • Windows installer is now 64-bit.

docs.title: Bug Fixes
docs.text:
• CrysFML simulation now shows Bragg peaks.
  • Inclusion of the space group setting in calculations.
  • The Project save button is now disabled for read-only example projects.
  • The Reset state functionality now resets calculator choice.
  • Overall performance has been improved.

docs.title: Features
docs.text: • Simulating and fitting multi-phase data using the CrysPy calculation engine is now supported.

docs.title: Changes
docs.text: • The MacOS installer is now digitally signed allowing for safer and less intrusive installation process.

docs.title: Bug Fixes
docs.text:
• Adding a new atom is now case-insensitve.
  • Changing sample name in the Sample tab functionality has been fixed.
  • Performance of project load has been improved.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Simulating and fitting time-of-flight (TOF) data using the CrysPy calculation engine is now supported.
  • Dependent and independent parameter constraints can be constructed for use during fitting.

docs.title: Changes
docs.text: • Reset the estimated standard deviations on the Analysis page after fitting if the Fit box becomes unchecked.

docs.title: Bug Fixes
docs.text:
• The lmfit minimization engine now works with the CrysFML and GSAS-II calculators.
  • Now project reset clears the simulated curve, experimental data, background and constraints tables.
  • Size of the simulation/analysis chart on the Summary page has been fixed.
  • The Project save button enable/disable state is now properly defined.
  • Fixed updating a sample model via the build-in CIF editor.
  • Now undo/redo triggers a parameter table update on the Analysis page.

docs.title: Changes
docs.text:
• Implemented automatic update of the application and made it easier to update the application manually.
  • Implemented a file-less interface with the CrysPy calculation engine.
  • Add Bragg peaks for the GSAS-II calculation engine.
  • Fitting calculations do not block the GUI on macOS anymore (implemented threading).
  • Redesigned and expanded the application settings window.

docs.title: Bug Fixes
docs.text: • Added an icon to the application window on Windows and Linux.

docs.title: Changes
docs.text:
• CrysFML and CrysPy simulations now show Bragg peaks.
  • Updated and extended user tutorials.
  • Contact email more prominently displayed.
  • More detailed README.md file for the project.
  • Updated module dependencies.
  • Updated application installer.

docs.title: Bug Fixes
docs.text:
• CrysFML and GSAS-II binding on Linux have been fixed.
  • Now project reset clears the experimental data correctly.
  • When an example is loaded, the summary save path is corrected.
  • Broken links in the About box have been updated.
  • Minor text fixes.

docs.title: Version 0.8.0-beta (3 May 2021)
docs.text: This is a new version of easyDiffraction, which is now based on the easyScience framework. Whereas some features present in the original implementation have not yet been implemented, new easyDiffraction has improved GUI, additional back-end calculator interfaces, enhancement of minimization options and other improvements over the original version of easyDiffraction (0.7.0).

docs.title: New features in version 0.8.0:
docs.text:
• Ability to run in simulation-only mode
  • Multiple crystallographic calculation engines: CrysPy, CrysFML and GSAS-II
  • Multiple minimization engines: lmfit, bumps and DFO_LS
  • High quality structure visualizer
  • Interactive HTML report generation
  • Built-in guided tutorials
  • Improved visualization of experimental and simulated data
  • Structural editor for cells and atoms
  • Improved project management
  • Parameter searching and filtering
  • Engine independent cif interpreter/editor
  • Engine independent background generation

docs.title: Abbreviations
docs.text: This page contains the most common abbreviation labels used in EasyDiffraction documentation.

docs.title: Dictionary type labels
docs.text:
• coreCIF Core CIF dictionary by the IUCr.
  • pdCIF Powder CIF dictionary by the IUCr.
  • customCIF Custom CIF dictionary by the CrysPy and EasyDiffraction developers.

docs.title: Experiment type labels
docs.text:
• pd-neut-cw Constant wavelength powder neutron diffraction.
  • pd-xray Powder X-ray diffraction.

docs.title: Project dictionaries
docs.text: All names for describing the EasyDiffraction project are divided into several dictionaries given below. Each keyword in the dictionaries has one badge showing the corresponding type of dictionary, and can have one or more badges showing the type of experiment to which the keyword belongs.

docs.title: Model dictionary
docs.text:
This dictionary provides data names for describing model parameters.

  • _cell coreCIF
    • _cell_angle_alpha coreCIF
    • _cell_angle_beta coreCIF
    • _cell_angle_gamma coreCIF
    • _cell_length_a coreCIF
    • _cell_length_b coreCIF
    • _cell_length_c coreCIF
  • _atom_site coreCIF
    • _atom_site_label coreCIF
    • _atom_site_type_symbol coreCIF
    • _atom_site_fract_x coreCIF
    • _atom_site_fract_y coreCIF
    • _atom_site_fract_z coreCIF
    • _atom_site_occupancy coreCIF
    • _atom_site_adp_type coreCIF
    • _atom_site_B_iso_or_equiv coreCIF
    • _atom_site_multiplicity coreCIF
    • _atom_site_Wyckoff_symbol coreCIF
  • _space_group coreCIF
    • _space_group_name_H-M_alt coreCIF
    • _space_group_IT_coordinate_system_code coreCIF

docs.title: Experiment and instrument dictionary
docs.text:
This dictionary provides data names for describing experimental and instrumental parameters.

  • _diffrn_radiation coreCIF
    • _diffrn_radiation_probe coreCIF
    • _diffrn_radiation_wavelength coreCIF
  • _pd_background customCIF
    • _pd_background_2theta customCIF
    • _pd_background_intensity customCIF
  • _pd_calib customCIF
    • _pd_calib_2theta_offset customCIF
  • _pd_instr customCIF
    • _pd_instr_resolution_u customCIF
    • _pd_instr_resolution_v customCIF
    • _pd_instr_resolution_w customCIF
    • _pd_instr_resolution_x customCIF
    • _pd_instr_resolution_y customCIF
    • _pd_instr_reflex_asymmetry_p1 customCIF
    • _pd_instr_reflex_asymmetry_p2 customCIF
    • _pd_instr_reflex_asymmetry_p3 customCIF
    • _pd_instr_reflex_asymmetry_p4 customCIF
  • _pd_meas pdCIF
    • _pd_meas_2theta customCIF
    • _pd_meas_intensity customCIF
    • _pd_meas_intensity_sigma customCIF
  • _phase customCIF
    • _phase_label customCIF
    • _phase_scale customCIF

docs.title: Project structure
docs.text:
Input/output files for EasyDiffraction are in simple and human-readable data format STAR/CIF with the specifications of International Union of Crystallography, where possible.

Example project structure for the constant wavelength powder neutron diffraction measurement is given below:

La0.5Ba0.5CoO3     - Project directory.
├── project.cif    - Main project description file.
├── models         - Folder with individual crystallographic phases.
│   ├── lbco.cif   - File with La0.5Ba0.5CoO3 phase parameters.
│   └── ...
├── experiments    - Folder with instrumental parameters and measured data.
│   ├── hrpt.cif   - Measured data from HRPT@PSI & instrumental parameters.
│   └── ...
└── summary
    └── report.cif - Summary report after structure refinement.

Here is the content of the project files:

docs.title: project.cif
docs.text:
data_La0.5Ba0.5CoO3

_description "neutrons, powder, constant wavelength, HRPT@PSI"

loop_
_model_cif_file_name
lbco.cif

loop_
_experiment_cif_file_name
hrpt.cif

docs.title: models / lbco.cif
docs.text:
data_lbco

_space_group_name_H-M_alt "P m -3 m"
_space_group_IT_coordinate_system_code 1

_cell_length_a      3.8909(1)
_cell_length_b      3.8909
_cell_length_c      3.8909
_cell_angle_alpha  90
_cell_angle_beta   90
_cell_angle_gamma  90

loop_
_atom_site_label
_atom_site_type_symbol
_atom_site_fract_x
_atom_site_fract_y
_atom_site_fract_z
_atom_site_occupancy
_atom_site_adp_type
_atom_site_B_iso_or_equiv
_atom_site_multiplicity
_atom_site_Wyckoff_symbol
La La   0   0   0     0.5  Biso 0.4958   1 a
Ba Ba   0   0   0     0.5  Biso 0.4943   1 a
Co Co   0.5 0.5 0.5   1    Biso 0.2567   1 b
O  O    0   0.5 0.5   1    Biso 1.4041   3 c

docs.title: experiments / hrpt.cif
docs.text:
data_hrpt

_diffrn_radiation_probe neutron
_diffrn_radiation_wavelength 1.494

_pd_meas_2theta_offset  0.6225(4)

_pd_instr_resolution_u  0.0834
_pd_instr_resolution_v -0.1168
_pd_instr_resolution_w  0.123
_pd_instr_resolution_x  0
_pd_instr_resolution_y  0.0797

_pd_instr_reflex_asymmetry_p1 0
_pd_instr_reflex_asymmetry_p2 0
_pd_instr_reflex_asymmetry_p3 0
_pd_instr_reflex_asymmetry_p4 0

loop_
_phase_label
_phase_scale
lbco 9.0976(3)

loop_
_pd_background_2theta
_pd_background_intensity
10  174.3
20  159.8
30  167.9
50  166.1
70  172.3
90  171.1
110 172.4
130 182.5
150 173.0
165 171.1

loop_
_pd_meas_2theta
_pd_meas_intensity
_pd_meas_intensity_sigma
10     167 12.6
10.05  157 12.5
10.1   187 13.3
10.15  197 14
10.2   164 12.5
10.25  171 13
...
164.6  153 20.7

164.7  187 27.9
164.75 175 38.2
164.8  168 30.9
164.85 109 41.2

docs.title: atom site
docs.text: coreCIF

docs.title: _atom_site
docs.text: Data items in this category record details about the atom sites in a crystal structure, such as the positional coordinates and atomic displacement parameters. Please see the IUCr page for further details.

docs.title: _atom_site_label
docs.text: This is a unique identifier for a particular site in the crystal.

docs.title: _atom_site_type_symbol
docs.text: A code to identify the atom species (singular or plural) occupying this site.

docs.title: _atom_site_fract
docs.text:
Atom-site coordinates as fractions of the _cell_length values.

  • _atom_site_fract_x
  • _atom_site_fract_y
  • _atom_site_fract_z

docs.title: _atom_site_occupancy
docs.text: The fraction of the atom type present at this site.

docs.title: _atom_site_adp_type
docs.text: A standard code used to describe the type of atomic displacement parameters used for the site. Currently only Biso (isotropic B) is supported.

docs.title: _atom_site_B_iso_or_equiv
docs.text: Isotropic atomic displacement parameter, or equivalent isotropic atomic displacement parameter, in angstroms squared, calculated from anisotropic displacement components.

docs.title: _atom_site_site_symmetry_multiplicity
docs.text:
optional parameter

The number of different sites that are generated by the application of the space-group symmetry to the coordinates given for this site. It is equal to the multiplicity given for this Wyckoff site in International Tables for Crystallography Vol. A (2002).

docs.title: _atom_site_Wyckoff_symbol
docs.text:
optional parameter

The Wyckoff symbol (letter) as listed in the space-group tables of International Tables for Crystallography Vol. A (2002).

docs.title: cell
docs.text: coreCIF

docs.title: _cell
docs.text: Data items in this category record details about the crystallographic cell parameters and their measurement. Please see the IUCr page for further details.

docs.title: _cell_angle
docs.text:
Unit-cell angles of the reported structure in degrees.

  • _cell_angle_alpha
  • _cell_angle_beta
  • _cell_angle_gamma

docs.title: _cell_length
docs.text:
Unit-cell lengths in angstroms corresponding to the structure reported.

  • _cell_length_a
  • _cell_length_b
  • _cell_length_c

docs.title: diffrn radiation
docs.text: coreCIF

docs.title: _diffrn_radiation
docs.text: Data items in this category describe the radiation used in measuring the diffraction intensities. Please see the IUCr page for further details.

docs.title: _diffrn_radiation_probe
docs.text:
The nature of the radiation used (i.e. the name of the subatomic particle or the region of the electromagnetic spectrum).

Supported values: neutron and x-ray

docs.title: _diffrn_radiation_wavelength
docs.text: The radiation wavelength in angstroms.

docs.title: pd background
docs.text: customCIF

docs.title: _pd_background
docs.text: This section contains information about background intensities at the selected points.

docs.title: _pd_background_2theta
docs.text: The diffractometer angles in degrees.

docs.title: _pd_background_intensity
docs.text: Calculated background intensities.

docs.title: pd calib
docs.text: customCIF

docs.title: _pd_calib
docs.text: This section defines the parameters used for the calibration of the instrument, similar to this IUCr section.

docs.title: _pd_calib_2theta_offset
docs.text: An offset angle (in degrees) used to calibrate 2theta.

docs.title: pd instr
docs.text: customCIF

docs.title: _pd_instr
docs.text: This section contains information relevant to the instrument used for the diffraction measurement, similar to this IUCr section.

docs.title: _pd_instr_resolution
docs.text:
Instrument resolution parameters.

  • _pd_instr_resolution_u
  • _pd_instr_resolution_v
  • _pd_instr_resolution_w
  • _pd_instr_resolution_x
  • _pd_instr_resolution_y

docs.title: _pd_instr_reflex_asymmetry
docs.text:
Peak profile asymmetry parameters.

  • _pd_instr_reflex_asymmetry_p1
  • _pd_instr_reflex_asymmetry_p2
  • _pd_instr_reflex_asymmetry_p3
  • _pd_instr_reflex_asymmetry_p4

docs.title: pd meas
docs.text: customCIF

docs.title: _pd_meas
docs.text: This section contains the measured diffractogram, similar to this IUCr section.

docs.title: _pd_meas_2theta
docs.text: The diffractometer angles in degrees.

docs.title: _pd_meas_intensity
docs.text: Measured intensities.

docs.title: _pd_meas_intensity_sigma
docs.text: Estimates standard deviation of the measured intensities.

docs.title: phase
docs.text: customCIF

docs.title: _phase
docs.text: This section contains information the phases associated with the current measurements data block.

docs.title: _phase_label
docs.text: Phase label.

docs.title: _phase_scale
docs.text: Phase scale.

docs.title: space group
docs.text: coreCIF

docs.title: _space_group
docs.text: Contains all the data items that refer to the space group as a whole. Please see the IUCr page for further details.

docs.title: _space_group_name_H-M_alt
docs.text: It allows any Hermann-Mauguin symbol to be given.

docs.title: _space_group_IT_coordinate_system_code
docs.text: This is the coordinate system code of space group as assigned in International Tables for Crystallography Vol. A
